repos.title: StatiCat (Creator)
blurb: A custom Discord bot developed in Nextcord, a Python wrapper of the Discord API.
Created a custom wrapper for Interaction webhooks, unique from regular commands, including:
<ul>
• Decorators with at-runtime registration and reloading of Application Commands.
• Automatic selection of subclasses for command parsing and handling via overloaded object creation.

repos.title: DuckyLighting (Creator)
blurb: A standalone Python project that controls the by-key lighting of a Ducky One2 RGB keyboard.
<ul>
• Reverse-engineered Duckyâ€™s USB protocol for lighting up the board by individual keys.
• Utilized a distribution of HIDAPI with a modified version of python-easyhid (C wrapper).
• Designed a metaclass to organize effect layers in a lighting configuration.

repos.title: Not Malware (Project Lead, Developer)
blurb: Guided a team of four students over the course of six two-week sprints to create an original game in Java for CS 2340: Objects and Design at Georgia Tech.
Recognized by the professor and other students as one of the best three games out of 114 other games submitted by student teams in Spring 2021.
<ul>
• Created a custom collision system, an advanced level-generation algorithm, and a game runtime framework.
• Implemented a Gradle and Java 9 modules project structure for efficient development, building, and execution across different machines and operating systems.

repos.title: Retail Rewards Bidding
blurb: An example server/application to showcase auction-style rewards from retail purchases.
Submitted for NCR's Retail Gamification challenge in HackGT 8.
<ul>
• Created a Flask-RESTful API server to interact with user and auction databases.
• Implemented login and authentication with JSON web tokens and one-way encryption.
• Created a wrapper for NCR's available APIs, including HMAC authorization token generation.
